quality_certificate_date: Find the certificate date in the header near the place of issue (example: "Puerto Montt, July 13th. 2025"). Keep the exact format from the document and add to quality_certificate_date.
producer: Take the legal producer name from "Name and Address of processing Plant" (example: "GRANJA MARINA TORNAGALEONES S A ..."). Keep only the name (address can be omitted) and add to producer.
container_no: Extract container number(s) from "Container and Seals Number"; format is usually 4 letters + 7 digits (example: "BMOU 9288991"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to container_no.
vessel: Find "Name of Vessel" and extract the vessel name and, if shown, the voyage number in one line (example: "MSC TAKORADI VIII - NX528R"). Add to vessel.
veterinary_seal: Extract only explicit veterinary/health seal numbers. Do not confuse with linear "Seal". If the document only shows "SEAL: ..." without a veterinary label, treat it as a linear seal and leave veterinary_seal empty. Add the value if found.
linear_seal: Take linear seal number(s) from "Container and Seals Number / SEAL: ..." (example: "FX34197306; A0036355"). If multiple, join with "; ". Add to linear_seal.
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... for each goods position/table row in the document and keep order. For each product_i fill all available fields. If an attribute is given once in a shared block (e.g., one Latin species for all lines), duplicate it in the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source fragments (cells/rows) used.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from "Description of Goods" (example: "FROZEN ATLANTIC SALMON FILLETS"). Join line breaks into one line and add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a scientific (Latin) name is shown in "Species and Scientific name", extract it (example: "SALMO SALAR") and add to products[i].latin_name. If none, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: If size/grade/pack is present in the goods description, extract it as one line and add to products[i].size_product. If not shown in the certificate, leave empty.
products[*].unit_box: If a unit/pack type is shown (e.g., "Kind of Packing: CASES"), keep the wording ("CASES", "BOXES", etc.) and add to products[i].unit_box. If no explicit unit, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Extract the number of packages from "Number of Packages" (example: "1375"). If a packing type is shown ("Kind of Packing: CASES"), you may keep "1375 CASES" as one line. Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].gross_weight: If gross weight per item is shown in the certificate, extract the number with unit in the original format and add to products[i].gross_weight. If only overall gross weight appears in notes/totals, use the explicit table value; if none, leave empty.
products[*].net_weight: Extract net weight per item. If a "Total Net Weight" is shown and per-item net weights are in the table, use the table values for products[i].net_weight and do not duplicate the total. Add the value. (Example of total: "Total Net Weight: 20.625,00".)
products[*].date_of_production: Take production date(s) from "Production Date". If multiple dates (table rows), list them with "; " in one line and add to products[i].date_of_production. Do not confuse with "Expiry Date".
